poem:
Title: Immortal Game of Life and Humor

Crass jest and sporting spectacle,
A battle of Titans, endeavors unreckonable.
The jesters jest, and sales mask the score,
In life's stadium, much like the lore.
Underneath the thundering human sea,
Is but a jest, and CBS the key.
In this game, humour's the laurel,
Victory lies not in the pigskin quarrel.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stephen Colbert on the Super Bowl: ‘The real winners were CBS ad sales’ Stephen Colbert Stephen Colbert took the stage for a special live post-Super Bowl Late Show – a “super post-game super monologue super”, as he put it – to digest the many, many sports and pop culture happenings during one of the longest NFL games in history. “For the second time in Super Bowl history, we went to extra innings,” he quipped. “So". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
